column1: Linquë súrisse is the Elvish name of a grass.
column2: pp. 197-9 (see especially note 34)The name appears on unpublished drawings related to an illustration (fig. 196) by J.R.R. Tolkien depicting the grass; Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull describes the physical appearance of the grass as a "bamboo-like plant".

column1: The name likely means "grass in the wind". It has been suggested that the first element is Quenya linque ("grass
column2: reed"). The second element would likely be related to súre.
